content.question: The total cost, in dollars, to order <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> units of a certain product is modeled by <math alttext="C of x, equals, 7 times x squared, plus 252" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>C</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>252</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. According to the model, for what size order is the cost per unit a minimum?

choices.label: An order of 1 unit has a minimum cost per unit.
An order of 6 units has a minimum cost per unit.
An order of 84 units has a minimum cost per unit.
An order of 252 units has a minimum cost per unit.

content.answer: An order of 6 units has a minimum cost per unit.
